get.description: Lists all applicants you've created, sorted by creation date in descending order.

parameters.description: The page to return. The first page is `page=1`
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The number of objects per page.
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: Whether to also include applicants scheduled for deletion.
parameters.name: include_deleted

post.description: Creates a single applicant. Returns an applicant object.

get.description: Retrieves a single applicant. Returns an applicant object.

put.description:
Allows updating applicant's information before any checks is created.
- Partial updates - Addresses and ID numbers present will replace existing ones - Same applicant validations to create applicant

post.description: Restores a single applicant scheduled for deletion.

get.description: Retrieves the Workflow Runs of the client. Returns a list of Workflow Run objects.

parameters.description: The number of the page to be retrieved. If not specified, defaults to 1.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: A list of comma separated status values to filter the results. Possible values are 'processing', 'awaiting_input', 'approved', 'declined', 'review', 'abandoned' and 'error'.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: A ISO-8601 date to filter results with a created date greater than (after) the one provided.
parameters.name: created_at_gt

parameters.description: A ISO-8601 date to filter results with a created date less than (before) the one provided.
parameters.name: created_at_lt

parameters.description: A string with the value 'desc' or 'asc' that allows to sort the returned list by the completed datetime either descending or ascending, respectively. If not specified, defaults to 'desc'.
parameters.name: sort

200.description: An array of Workflow Run objects matching the query parameters.

post.description: Creates and starts a Workflow Run. Returns a Workflow Run object.

get.description: A single workflow run can be retrieved by calling this endpoint with the unique identifier of the Workflow Run.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Workflow Run.
parameters.name: workflow_run_id

get.description: Retrieves the signed evidence file for the designated Workflow Run

parameters.description: Workflow Run ID
parameters.name: workflow_run_id

get.summary: Retrieve Workflow Run Evidence Summary File

get.description: All documents belonging to an applicant can be listed from this endpoint

post.description: Documents are uploaded using this endpoint. Along with the file upload the relevant document type must be specified. Documents must be uploaded as a multipart form. The valid file types are: jpg, png and pdf. The file size must be between 2KB and 3MB.

get.description: A single document can be retrieved by calling this endpoint with the document's unique identifier.
Downloads specific documents belonging to an applicant. If successful, the response will be the binary data representing the image.
Downloads a document video. If successful, the response will be the binary data representing the video.
Lists the live photos that belong to an applicant.

parameters.description: The id of the applicant the live photos belong to.
parameters.name: applicant_id

post.description: You can upload live photos to this endpoint. Like document upload, files must be uploaded as a multipart form. Valid file types are jpg, png and pdf. The file size must be between 32KB and 10MB. Live photos are validated at the point of upload to check that they contain exactly one face. This validation can be disabled by setting the advanced_validation argument to false.

get.description: Retrieves a single live photo. Returns a live photo object.

parameters.description: The live photo's unique identifier.
parameters.name: live_photo_id

get.description: Live photos are downloaded using this endpoint.

parameters.description: The live photo's unique identifier.
parameters.name: live_photo_id

get.description: Lists all the live videos that belong to an applicant.

parameters.description: The id of the applicant the live videos belong to.
parameters.name: applicant_id

get.description: Retrieves a single live video. Returns the corresponding live video object.

parameters.description: The live video's unique identifier.
parameters.name: live_video_id

get.description: Live videos are downloaded using this endpoint.

parameters.description: The live video's unique identifier.
parameters.name: live_video_id

get.description: Returns the binary data representing a single frame from a live video.

parameters.description: The live video's unique identifier.
parameters.name: live_video_id

200.description: The live video frame's binary data.

get.description: The tasks of a Workflow can be retrieved by calling this endpoint with the unique identifier of the Workflow Run.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Workflow Run to which the Tasks belong.
parameters.name: workflow_run_id

200.description: An array of subset Task objects that were already started or completed, ordered by the created_at field, in ascending order.

get.description: A single task can be retrieved by calling this endpoint with the unique identifier of the Task and Workflow Run.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Workflow Run to which the Task belongs.
parameters.name: workflow_run_id

parameters.description: The identifier of the Task you want to retrieve.
parameters.name: task_id

post.description: Completes a Send / Receive Data Task.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Workflow Run to which the Task belongs.
parameters.name: workflow_run_id

parameters.description: The identifier of the Task you want to complete.
parameters.name: task_id

get.description: Lists all the motion captures that belong to an applicant.

parameters.description: The id of the applicant the motion captures belong to.
parameters.name: applicant_id

get.description: Retrieves a single motion capture. Returns the corresponding motion capture object.

parameters.description: The motion capture's unique identifier.
parameters.name: motion_capture_id

get.description: Motion captures are downloaded using this endpoint.

parameters.description: The motion capture's unique identifier.
parameters.name: motion_capture_id

get.description: Instead of the whole capture binary, a single frame can be downloaded using this endpoint. Returns the binary data representing the frame.

parameters.description: The motion capture's unique identifier.
parameters.name: motion_capture_id

200.description: The motion capture frame's binary data.

get.description: List all available monitors for an applicant

parameters.description: The id of the applicant the watchlist monitors belong to. If omitted, all monitors for the account will be listed.
parameters.name: applicant_id

parameters.description: Whether to also include deleted (inactive) monitors.
parameters.name: include_deleted

post.description: Creates a new monitor for the applicant

get.description: Retrieves a single monitor

parameters.description: The watchlist monitor's unique identifier.
parameters.name: monitor_id

get.description: List match IDs on this monitor, as well as their enabled/disabled status

patch.description: Update the status of the given matches

post.description: Triggers a new check with an updated report to be generated by the monitor, as if the monitor had received an update.

Location.description: Link to the newly generated report.

get.description: Lists the ID photos that belong to an applicant.

parameters.description: The id of the applicant the ID photos belong to.
parameters.name: applicant_id

post.description: You can upload ID photos to this endpoint. Like document upload, files must be uploaded as a multipart form. Valid file types are jpg, png and pdf. The file size must be between 32KB and 10MB.

get.description: Retrieves a single ID photo. Returns a ID photo object.

parameters.description: The ID photo's unique identifier.
parameters.name: id_photo_id

get.description: ID photos are downloaded using this endpoint.

parameters.description: The ID photo's unique identifier.
parameters.name: id_photo_id

get.description: Run a health check on the Onfido API
Lists all webhooks you've created.

default.description: Your server should acknowledge success by responding with an HTTP 20x response within 10 seconds.

post.description: Registers a webhook. Returns a webhook object.

get.description: Retrieves a single webhook. Returns a webhook object.

put.description: Edits a webhook. Returns the updated webhook object.

post.description: Resends events to all webhooks registered with a matching environment in your account.

204.description: Webhooks are resent for the respective checks

422.description: Request was received but it could not be processed

get.description: Search for addresses by postcode

post.description: Generates an SDK token. Returns a token object containing the SDK token.

get.description: Returns all repeat attempts for a given Document report

post.description: Create Feedback on checks and reports

get.description: Retrieves a single check. Returns a check object.

post.description: Initiates a check for an applicant, which can contain one or more reports. Returns a check object.

get.description: Retrieves a single check. Returns a check object.
Downloads a PDF of a check with a given check ID. Returns the binary data representing the PDF.
All the reports belonging to a particular check can be listed from this endpoint.
A single report can be retrieved using this endpoint with the corresponding unique identifier.

id.description: The unique identifier for the video.

created_at.description: The date and time at which the video was uploaded.

download_href.description: The uri that can be used to download the video.

file_name.description: The name of the uploaded file.

file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

file_type.description: The file type of the uploaded file.

challenge.description: Challenge the end user was asked to perform during the video recording.

task_def_id.description: The identifier for the Task Definition.

workflow_run_id.description: The workflow run id the task belongs to.

input.description: Input object with the fields used by the Task to execute.

output.description: Output object with the fields produced by the Task execution.

created_at.description: The date and time when the Task was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the Task was last updated.

id.description: The unique identifier for the motion capture.

created_at.description: The date and time at which the motion capture was uploaded.

download_href.description: The uri that can be used to download the motion capture.

file_name.description: The name of the uploaded file.

file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

file_type.description: The file type of the uploaded file.

id.description: The unique identifier for the monitor.

created_at.description: The date and time at which the monitor was created.

deleted_at.description: The date and time at which the monitor was deleted. If the monitor is still active, this field will be null.

applicant_id.description: The ID for the applicant associated with the monitor.

report_name.description: The name of the report type the monitor creates. Can be either "watchlist_standard" or "watchlist_aml".

tags.description: A list of tags associated with this monitor. These tags will be applied to each check this monitor creates.

sandbox.description: Indicates whether the object was created in the sandbox or not.

report_id.description: The unique identifier of the completed Document report.

repeat_attempts.description: An array of repeat attempt objects. If no repeat attempts were found, the array will be empty. The number of objects returned can increase over time if more matches are received.

attempts_count.description: The total number of attempts using the same document, including the current report under assessment.

attempts_clear_rate.description: A number between 0 and 1 which indicates the proportion of attempts that have been cleared, including the current report under assessment.

unique_mismatches_count.description: The number of unique entries in the repeat_attempts field for which at least one of the fields is a mismatch.

document_id.description: The unique identifier of the uploaded document.

expected_result.description: The expected result for the check or report.

check_id.description: The ID of the check (only if report_id is not provided).

report_id.description: The ID of the check (only if check_id is not provided).

email.description: The applicant's email address. Required if doing a US check, or a UK check for which `applicant_provides_data` is `true`.

id.description: The unique identifier for the applicant.

created_at.description: The date and time when this applicant was created.

delete_at.description: The date and time when this applicant is scheduled to be deleted.

applicant_id.description: The unique identifier for the Applicant.

workflow_id.description: The unique identifier for the Workflow.

tags.description: Tags or labels assigned to the workflow run.

created_at.description: The date and time when the Workflow Run was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the Workflow Run was last updated.

id.description: The unique identifier for the Workflow Run.

workflow_version_id.description: The identifier for the Workflow version.

dashboard_url.description: The URL for viewing the Workflow Run results on your Onfido Dashboard.

status.description: The status of the Workflow Run.

output.description: Output object contains all of the properties configured on the Workflow version.

reasons.description: The reasons the Workflow Run outcome was reached. Configurable when creating the Workflow version.

custom_data.description: Object with Custom Input Data to be used in the Workflow Run.

file_type.description: The file type of the uploaded file

side.description: The side of the document, if applicable. The possible values are front and back

issuing_country.description: The issuing country of the document, a 3-letter ISO code.

applicant_id.description: The ID of the applicant whose document is being uploaded.

id.description: The unique identifier for the document

created_at.description: The date and time at which the document was uploaded

download_href.description: The uri that can be used to download the document

file_name.description: The name of the uploaded file

file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes

validate_image_quality.description: Defaults to false. When true the submitted image will undergo an image quality validation which may take up to 5 seconds.

id.description: The unique identifier for the photo.

created_at.description: The date and time at which the photo was uploaded.

download_href.description: The uri that can be used to download the photo.

file_name.description: The name of the uploaded file.

file_type.description: The file type of the uploaded file.

file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

applicant_id.description: The ID of the applicant whose live photo is being uploaded.

advanced_validation.description: Validates that the live photo contains exactly one face.

id.description: The unique identifier for the photo.

created_at.description: The date and time at which the photo was uploaded.

download_href.description: The uri that can be used to download the photo.

file_name.description: The name of the uploaded file.

file_type.description: The file type of the uploaded file.

file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

applicant_id.description: The ID of the applicant whose ID photo is being uploaded.

enabled.description: Determine if the webhook is active.

events.description: The events that will be published to the webhook. If the events parameter is omitted all the events will be subscribed.

environments.description: The environments from which the webhook will receive events. Allowed values are “sandbox” and “live”. If the environments parameter is omitted the webhook will receive events from both environments.

payload_version.description: Webhook version used to control the payload object when sending webhooks.

id.description: The unique identifier of the webhook.

token.description: Webhook secret token used to sign the webhook's payload.

href.description: The API endpoint to retrieve the webhook.

webhook_url.description: The url that will listen to notifications (must be https).

flat_number.description: The flat number of this address

building_number.description: The building number of this address

building_name.description: The building name of this address

street.description: The street of the applicant's address

sub_street.description: The sub-street of the applicant's address

town.description: The town of the applicant's address

postcode.description: The postcode or ZIP of the applicant's address

country.description: The 3 character ISO country code of this address. For example, GBR is the country code for the United Kingdom

state.description: The address state. US states must use the USPS abbreviation (see also ISO 3166-2:US), for example AK, CA, or TX.

applicant_id.description: The unique identifier of the applicant

cross_device_url.description: The URL to be used by the Web SDK for the cross device flow.

webhook_ids.description: An array of webhook ids describing which webhooks to trigger for this check.

applicant_id.description: The ID of the applicant to do the check on.

applicant_provides_data.description: Send an applicant form to applicant to complete to proceed with check. Defaults to false.

tags.description: Array of tags being assigned to this check.

redirect_uri.description: For checks where `applicant_provides_data` is `true`, redirect to this URI when the applicant has submitted their data.

id.description: The unique identifier for the check.

created_at.description: The date and time when this check was created.

status.description: The current state of the check in the checking process.

result.description: The overall result of the check, based on the results of the constituent reports.

form_uri.description: A link to the applicant form, if `applicant_provides_data` is `true`.

results_uri.description: A link to the corresponding results page on the Onfido dashboard.

sandbox.description: Indicates whether the object was created in the sandbox or not.

document_ids.description: Optional. An array of document ids, for use with Document reports only. If omitted, the Document report will use the most recently uploaded document by default.

applicant_provides_data.description: Send an applicant form to applicant to complete to proceed with check. Defaults to false.

asynchronous.description: Defaults to `true`. If set to `false`, you will only receive a response when all reports in your check have completed.

suppress_form_emails.description: For checks where `applicant_provides_data` is `true`, applicant form will not be automatically sent if `suppress_form_emails` is set to `true`. You can manually send the form at any time after the check has been created, using the link found in the form_uri attribute of the check object. Write-only. Defaults to false.

sub_result.description: Triggers responses for particular sub-results for sandbox Document reports.

consider.description: Array of names of particular reports to return consider as their results. This is a feature available in sandbox testing

state_code.description: Two letter code of issuing state (state-issued driving licenses only)

id.description: The unique identifier for the report. Read-only.

created_at.description: The date and time at which the report was first initiated. Read-only.

href.description: The API endpoint to retrieve the report. Read-only.

check_id.description: The ID of the check to which the report belongs. Read-only.

documents.description: Array of objects with document ids that were used in the Onfido engine. [ONLY POPULATED FOR DOCUMENT AND FACIAL SIMILARITY REPORTS]

report_status.description: The current state of the report in the checking process. Read-only.

report_result.description: The result of the report. Read-only.

report_sub_result.description: The sub_result of the report. It gives a more detailed result for document reports only, and will be null otherwise. Read-only.

matches.description: Returns any matching applicant IDs as entries inside a matches array under a properties bag.

matched_address.description: Returns address number which has been matched.

matched_addresses.description: Returns array of sources which contain matched addresses for the corresponding address number.

records.description: Returns any matches including, but not limited to, name and date of birth of match, aliases and associates, and relevant events and sources.
Returns any matches including, but not limited to, name and date of birth of match, aliases and associates, and relevant events and sources.
Returns any matches including, but not limited to, name and date of birth of match, aliases and associates, and relevant events and sources.

address.description: This property provides the address on the document.

document_type.description: This property provides the document type according to the set of supported documents.

first_names.description: This property provides the first names on the document, including any initials and middle names.

last_names.description: This property provided the last names on the document.

issue_date.description: This property provides the issue date of the document.

issuer.description: This property provides the document issuer (e.g. HSBC, British Gas).

summary_period_start.description: This property provides the summary period start date.

summary_period_end.description: This property provides the summary period end date.

country_of_residence.description: The applicant's country of residence in 3-letter ISO code.

us_driving_licence_shared.description: An object that contains all accepted fields for the Driver's License Data Verification report.

issue_state.description: Two letter code of issuing state (state-issued driving licenses only)

city.description: The city of the owner's address

date_of_birth.description: Date of birth in yyyy-mm-dd format

expiration_date.description: Expiration date of the driving licence in yyyy-mm-dd format

postal_code.description: The postcode or ZIP of the owner's address

id.description: ID of uploaded document to use.

dark_photo.description: When an image of the document is too dark to be able to see data points.

glare_on_photo.description: When there is light reflecting on the document causing glare to obstruct data points.

blurred_photo.description: When data points are blurred and no reference can be made elsewhere in the document or if the data points are too blurry and 'they could be something else'.

covered_photo.description: When data points have been covered either by the applicant or by another object such as a sticker.

other_photo_issue.description: Any other reason not listed, such as when holograms are obscuring data points.

damaged_document.description: When a document is damaged and we are unable to make out data points.

incorrect_side.description: When the incorrect side of a document has been uploaded, and we have not received the front.

cut_off_document.description: When data points are not included in the image due to the document being cut off.

no_document_in_image.description: If no document has been uploaded or there is a blank image.

two_documents_uploaded.description: When 2 different documents are submitted in the same check.

obscured_data_points.description: When data points are obscured to the point that we cannot confirm if the fonts match the expected ones.

obscured_security_features.description: When a critical security feature is obscured. This can also refer to when the holder's wet signature, necessary for the document to be valid, is not present.

abnormal_document_features.description: One of 3 reasons (1) OCR Assisted Scans (i.e. when you're able to move the mouse and highlight part of text), (2) Severely Washed out Background, (3) Overlapping Text.

watermarks_digital_text_overlay.description: Any digital text or electronic watermarks on the document.

corner_removed.description: If the corner has been physically cut off. This can be found on some documents that are no longer valid.

missing_back.description: When the back of a document is needed for processing, but is not available.

digital_document.description: When a document has been published digitally, there aren't enough security features to review so we cannot perform a full fraud assessment.

photo_of_screen.description: When the applicant's document is on a physical screen or device.

screenshot.description: When the applicant has used their mobile phone, tablet, or computer to take a photo within the device.

document_on_printed_paper.description: When the applicant has previously captured an image of the document, printed it out, and has now taken a photo of this print out to upload.

scan.description: When the document has clearly been captured using a scanner and there are visible indicators of this

digital_tampering.description: Flags when evidence is found that the image was manipulated by Photoshop, or other software.

fake_webcam.description: Flags when evidence is found that a fake webcam was used.

time_of_capture.description: Flags when evidence is found that the live photo was taken more than 24 hours before live photo upload.

emulator.description: Flags when evidence is found that an Android emulator was used.

reasons.description: Additional comma separated details such as the exact digital tampering software used, or the name of the fake webcam.

digital_tampering.description: Flags when evidence is found that the image was manipulated by Photoshop, or other software.

fake_webcam.description: Flags when evidence is found that a fake webcam was used.

time_of_capture.description: Flags when evidence is found that the live photo was taken more than 24 hours before live photo upload.

emulator.description: Flags when evidence is found that an Android emulator was used.

reasons.description: Additional comma separated details such as the exact digital tampering software used, or the name of the fake webcam.

fake_webcam.description: Flags when evidence is found that a fake webcam was used.

challenge_reuse.description: Flags when evidence is found that the video was uploaded in an attempt to circumvent the randomness of the speaking and head turn challenges

emulator.description: Flags when evidence is found that an Android emulator was used.

reasons.description: Additional comma separated details such as the name of the fake webcam.

created_at.description: The date and time when the Task was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the Task was last updated.

document_id.description: The unique identifier of the uploaded document to run extraction on
The unique identifier of the uploaded document

webhook_event_payload_object.description: The object affected by this event.

id.description: The unique identifier of the resource.

status.description: The current state of the object, if available.

completed_at_iso8601.description: The date and time when the operation was completed, if available.

resource_type.description: Indicates the resource affected by this event.

action.description: The event that triggered this webhook.

resource.description: The resource affected by this event.

resource_id.description: ID of the resource whose webhooks are to be retriggered.

event.description: The events that should retrigger webhooks. Accepts values check.completed.

report_id.description: The unique identifier of the matching Document report.

applicant_id.description: The unique identifier of the applicant for the matching Document report.

date_of_birth.description: Whether the dates of birth are exactly the same or are different.

names.description: Whether the names are exactly the same or are different.

result.description: The report result of this attempt.

created_at.description: When the matching report was created.

completed_at.description: When the matching report was completed.

issuing_state.description: The state that issued the document (if available).

gender.description: Gender (Valid values are Male and Female).

date_of_birth.description: Date of birth in YYYY-MM-DD format.

date_of_expiry.description: Date of expiry in YYYY-MM-DD format.

expiry_date.description: Date of expiry in YYYY-MM-DD format.

issuing_state.description: The state that issued the document.

workflow_run_shared_link.description: Object for the configuration of the Workflow Run link.

url.description: Link to access the Workflow Run without the need to integrate with Onfido's SDKs.

completed_redirect_url.description: When the interactive section of the Workflow Run has completed successfully, the user will be redirected to this URL instead of seeing the default Onfido 'thank you' page.

expired_redirect_url.description: When the link has expired, the user will be immediately redirected to this URL instead of seeing the default Onfido error message.

expires_at.description: Date and time when the link will expire.

language.description: The code for the language when the workflow run is acessed using the link.

workflow_run_response_error.description: Error object. Only set when the Workflow Run status is 'error'.

message.description: A textual description of the error.

is_qualified.description: Whether they are qualified for a passenger car, such as a “B” class in the UK

obtainment_date.description: Date the class qualification was obtained

expiry_date.description: Date the class qualification expires, which may be different to doc expiry

restricted_licence.description: True for **limited/restricted** driving license, including learner's permits

raw_licence_category.description: Underlying, non-normalised, licence category (e.g. "Junior operators license")

raw_vehicle_classes.description: Comma-separated vehicle classes that the user is qualified for

pan.description: The applicant's PAN (10 digit alphanumeric number).

document_breakdown_data_comparison.description: Asserts whether data on the document is consistent with data provided when creating an applicant through the API.

document_breakdown_data_validation_break.description: If this is flagged, the document has expired.
If this is flagged, the expiration date has the incorrect format.

document_breakdown_data_validation.description: Asserts whether algorithmically validatable elements are correct.

document_breakdown_image_integrity_break.description: Asserts whether the quality of the image was sufficient for processing.
Asserts whether the submitted document is supported.
Asserts whether the image was a colour one.
Asserts if the document was of enough quality to be able to perform a fraud inspection.

document_breakdown_image_integrity.description: Asserts if the document is of sufficient quality to verify.

document_breakdown_visual_authenticity_b.description: Fonts in the document don't match the expected ones.
The pictures of the person identified on the document show signs of tampering or alteration.
The document doesn't match the expected template for the document type and country it is from.
Security features expected on the document are missing or wrong.
The document was not present when the photo was taken.
Indication of digital tampering in the image.
This sub-breakdown is returned for backward compatibility reasons. Its value will be consider when at least one of the other breakdowns is consider, and clear when all the other breakdowns are clear.
No face was detected on the document.

document_breakdown_visual_authenticity.description: Asserts whether visual, non-textual, elements are correct given the type of document.

document_breakdown_data_consistency.description: Asserts whether data represented in multiple places on the document is consistent.

document_breakdown_police_record.description: Asserts whether the document had been identified as lost, stolen or otherwise compromised.

document_breakdown_compromised_document.description: Asserts whether the image of the document has been found in our internal database or if it was used in a suspicious way.

document_breakdown_age_validation.description: Asserts whether the age calculated from the document's date of birth data point is greater than or equal to the minimum accepted age.

document_breakdown_issuing_authority_bre.description: Asserts whether the document NFC chip is original or cloned.
Asserts whether the document NFC chip data was tampered.

document_breakdown_issuing_authority.description: Asserts whether data on the document matches the issuing authority data.

score.description: A floating point number between 0 and 1 that expresses how similar the two faces are, where 1 is a perfect match.

document_id.description: The UUID for the document containing the extracted face that was used for face matching.

facial_similarity_photo_breakdown_face_c.description: Contains a score value under the properties bag.
Asserts whether the face in the document matches the face in the live photo.

facial_similarity_photo_breakdown_image_.description: Asserts a single face of good enough quality has been found in both the document image and the live photo.
Asserts whether the live photo is trustworthy - i.e. not digitally tampered, from a fake webcam, or from other dubious sources.
Asserts whether the quality and integrity of the uploaded files were sufficient to perform a face comparison.

score.description: A floating point number between 0 and 1. The closer the score is to 0, the more likely it is to be a spoof.

facial_similarity_photo_breakdown_visual.description: Contains a score value under the properties bag.
Asserts whether the person in the live photo is real and not a spoof.

facial_similarity_photo_fully_auto_break.description: Asserts whether the live photo is trustworthy - i.e. not digitally tampered, from a fake webcam, or from other dubious sources.
Asserts whether the quality and integrity of the uploaded files were sufficient to perform a face comparison.

facial_similarity_video_breakdown_face_c.description: Asserts whether the face in the document matches the face in the live video.

facial_similarity_video_breakdown_image_.description: Asserts a single face of good enough quality has been found in both the document image and the live video.
Asserts whether the live video is trustworthy - e.g. not from a fake webcam.
Asserts whether the quality and integrity of the uploaded files were sufficient to perform a face comparison.

facial_similarity_video_breakdown_visual.description: Asserts whether the numbers and head movements were correctly executed.
Asserts whether the live video is not a spoof (such as videos of digital screens).
Asserts whether the person in the live video is real (not a spoof) and live.

facial_similarity_motion_breakdown_face_.description: Asserts whether the face in the document matches the face in the motion capture.

facial_similarity_motion_breakdown_image.description: Asserts a single face of good enough quality has been found in both the document image and in the motion capture.
Asserts whether the motion capture is trustworthy - e.g. not from a fake webcam.
Asserts whether the quality and integrity of the uploaded files were sufficient to perform a face comparison.

facial_similarity_motion_breakdown_visua.description: Asserts whether the motion capture is not a spoof (such as videos of digital screens).
Asserts whether the person in the motion capture is real (not a spoof) and live.

known_faces_breakdown_previously_seen_fa.description: Asserts whether the applicant's most recent facial media (live photo or live video) matches any other live photos or live videos already in your Onfido account database.

known_faces_breakdown_image_integrity.description: Asserts whether the uploaded live photo or live video and the content contained within it were of sufficient quality to perform a face comparison.

applicant_id.description: The applicant ID of the matched applicant.

score.description: A floating point number between 0 and 1 that expresses how similar the two faces are, where 1 is a perfect match.

media_id.description: The corresponding UUID for the media type.

media_type.description: The media type (for example live_photos or live_videos).

suspected.description: Indicates if match is suspected based on fuzzy name matching feature. Dependent on feature being active for account, otherwise defaults to true.

identity_enhanced_breakdown_sources_brea.description: The number of sources which produced a match to applicant details.

identity_enhanced_breakdown_sources.description: Asserts if any sources that an applicant's details have been verified against have produced a match.

identity_enhanced_breakdown_address_brea.description: The number of address matches against credit agencies.

identity_enhanced_breakdown_address.description: Asserts if the applicant's address matches any sources.

identity_enhanced_breakdown_date_of_birt.description: Date of birth match against credit agencies.
Date of birth match against voting register.
Asserts if the applicant's date of birth matches any sources.

identity_enhanced_breakdown_mortality.description: Asserts if the applicant's details match any death records.

watchlist_aml_breakdown_sanction.description: Asserts if there are any records found in Government and International Organisations Sanctions Lists.

watchlist_aml_breakdown_politically_expo.description: Asserts if there are any records found in the proprietary database of Politically Exposed Persons sourced from government lists, websites and other media sources.

watchlist_aml_breakdown_legal_and_regula.description: Asserts if there are any records found in Law-Enforcement and Regulatory bodies Monitored Lists (including Terrorism, Money Laundering and Most Wanted lists).

watchlist_aml_breakdown_adverse_media.description: Asserts if there are any records found of negative events reported by publicly and generally available media sources.

proof_of_address_breakdown_data_comparis.description: Asserts whether the first name, last name and address provided by the applicant match those on the PoA document.

proof_of_address_breakdown_document_clas.description: Asserts whether the document is of a valid type as PoA.

proof_of_address_breakdown_image_integri.description: Asserts whether the quality of the uploaded document was sufficient to verify the address.

us_driving_licence_breakdown_document.description: Asserts whether the document data provided matches a real driving license in the DMV driver's license database.

us_driving_licence_breakdown_address.description: Asserts whether the address data provided matches a real driving license in the DMV driver's license database.

us_driving_licence_breakdown_personal.description: Asserts whether the personal data provided matches a real driving license in the DMV driver's license database.

device_intelligence_breakdown_breakdown_.description: Asserts whether the device used to upload the media is trustworthy, i.e. it is a real, physical device.

sdk_version.description: The SDK version that was used.

sdk_source.description: The SDK used to upload the media.

authentication_type.description: The token used to authenticate the request.

raw_model.description: The model as set by the phone manufacturer (for Android and iOS) or the browser manufacturer (for Web). The model can be presented in name or number form depending on each manufacturer implementation.

os.description: The operating system of the device. The value came from manufacturer implementation (for Android and iOS) or browser's user agent (for Web).

browser.description: The browser name reported by the browser's user agent.

emulator.description: Whether the device is an emulator.

randomized_device.description: Whether the device is providing false randomized device and network information.

fake_network_request.description: Whether device is using stolen security tokens to send the network information.

true_os.description: The true operating system of the device.

os_anomaly.description: The likelihood of an operating system anomaly between the true OS and the OS sent by the device.

remote_software.description: Whether the device is controlled via remote software.

ip_reputation.description: Whether there is highly suspicious traffic related to the IP address. The risk depends on the overall ratio of clear checks on a given IP.

device_fingerprint_reuse.description: The number of times the device was used to create a report for a new applicant. A value greater than 1 indicates potential device reuse.

single_device_used.description: Whether the document or biometric media were uploaded from a single device.

document_capture.description: Whether the document media were live captured from the device camera.

biometric_capture.description: Whether the biometric media were live captured from the device camera.

address.description: The IP address that uploaded the media.

vpn_detection.description: The likelihood of the network connection being a VPN.

proxy_detection.description: The likelihood of the network connection being a Proxy.

type.description: The type of organization that owns this IP address.

city.description: City location of the IP address.

region.description: Region location of the IP address.

country.description: Country location of the IP address in a three letter format.
